article:
Most people in the world like to enjoy nature. Travel is one of the most popular ways. Nowadays modern transportation can take people everywhere. But people who lived before the 1880s probably would not travel very far. They would not have time to travel far from their work. Anyone who travelled   on land  would usually walk or ride a
horse. But in Germany a man named Karl Benz had an idea that  _  the
world in a dramatic way. In 1885, he made  the first car  . His car had
three wheels,  unlike  most cars today. The car could only go  at a speed of  16 kilometres an hour.
At around the same time, the man   making  his first car in Detroit, America is called Henry Ford. Detroit is
now still famous all over the world as the centre of American car-making.
Cars were very few and only   _  people
could buy them.  _  , in England cars were thought to be  _  at that time, so for a few years someone  had to  walk
in front of every car  waving  a red flag! This was to make sure
that the car did not go too fast and hurt  anyone  .
In the 1910s, Henry Ford had   _  a
better kind of car called the Model T Ford and he built a  _  where
the cars could be made  by machines  . In this way the car could be
made  _  and the cost was less and more and more people could  _  them. But there was still a problem  _  all
the cars were black. That was because it was  cheaper  to produce
cars that were all the same color1. Now, of course, you can buy cars in all  _  .
